::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**MFT1.3 Coastal saltmarshes and reedbeds**](/efg-info/MFT1_3.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/MFT1_3_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: MFT1.3.web.orig v2.0.

> The indicative map for for coastal saltmarshes and reedbeds (MFT1.3) was developed by resampling known distribution records summarised by McOwen et al. (2017). We used a buffer of 1km around the distribution data and a 30 arc second grid, thus large aggregations (> 1km<sup>2</sup>) are depicted as major occurrences, and the buffer areas with small occurrences are shown as minor occurrences. The original data is available at [UNEP-WCMC](http://data.unep-wcmc.org/datasets/43).

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**GlobalSaltmarshes2017** (McOwen et al. 2017):

Source of _validated distribution records_.
 Resolution: <1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset               |url                                                      |
|:---------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------|
|GlobalSaltmarshes2017 |<https://data.unep-wcmc.org/datasets/43>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Reclassification* :: *Buffering*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,specific*.

Ground observations are _yes_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Qualitative expert assessment,documented,qualitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: MFT1.3.web.orig**, version v2.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: MFT1.3.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**MFT1.3.web.orig** (v2.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MFT1.3.web.orig_v2.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091029){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.MFT1_3_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**MFT1.3.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MFT1.3.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- McOwen CJ, Weatherdon LV, van Bochove JW, Sullivan E, Blyth S, Zockler C, Stanwell-Smith D, Kingston N, Martin CS, Spalding M, Fletcher S  (2017) *A global map of saltmarshes* **Biodiversity Data Journal** 5: e11764 [DOI:10.3897/BDJ.5.e11764](http:dx.doi.org/10.3897/BDJ.5.e11764)
